intro: Lomatogonium carinthiacum var. carinthiacum, commonly known as the Carinthian lomatogonium, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It features slender, upright stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly serrated edge. This species is adapted to rocky and limestone-rich soils and is often found in alpine meadows.
